events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled in Obergefell v. Hodges that the right of same-sex couples to marry is guaranteed by the Fourteenth Amendment.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: U.S. Supreme Court Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage Nationwide

events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court granted federal recognition to same-sex marriage when it overturned the Defense of Marriage Act.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: J.K. Rowling Releases First Harry Potter Book

events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court struck down sodomy laws in the country in the landmark decision Lawrence v. Texas.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: United Nations Established in San Francisco

events.originalText: J. K. Rowling's Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, the first book in the Harry Potter fantasy novel series, is released.
events.subtitle: J. K. Rowling
events.headline: American Forces Clear Belleau Wood of German Troops in WWI

events.originalText: At a conference in San Francisco, delegates from 50 nations signed a charter establishing the United Nations.
events.subtitle: United Nations Conference on International Organization
events.headline: Bolshevik Revolutionaries Rob Bank Stagecoach in Tiflis

events.originalText: World War I: The 26-day Battle of Belleau Wood near the Marne River in France ended with American forces finally clearing that forest of German troops.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: French Chemist Henri Moissan Isolates Elemental Fluorine

events.originalText: Organized by Vladimir Lenin and Joseph Stalin, among others, Bolshevik revolutionaries robbed a bank stagecoach in Tiflis, present-day Georgia.
events.subtitle: Vladimir Lenin
events.headline: Julia Gardiner Tyler Marries John Tyler, Becomes First Lady

events.originalText: The 1906 French Grand Prix, the first Grand Prix motor racing competition, began near Le Mans.
events.subtitle: 1906 French Grand Prix
events.headline: Spanish Troops Storm Fort Mose in War of Jenkins' Ear

events.originalText: Bangui, the capital and largest city of the present-day Central African Republic, was founded in French Congo.
events.subtitle: Bangui
events.headline: Council of Pisa Elects Peter of Candia as Pope Alexander V

events.originalText: French chemist Henri Moissan successfully isolated elemental fluorine (pictured in liquid state), for which he later won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry.
events.subtitle: Henri Moissan
events.headline: Mongols Achieve Decisive Victory over Seljuq Turks in Anatolia

events.originalText: French authorities suppressed the June Days uprising, in which workers rioted in response to plans to close the National Workshops.
events.subtitle: June Days uprising

events.originalText: Despite a thirty year age gap, Julia Gardiner Tyler married John Tyler at the Church of the Ascension and became the First Lady of the United States.
events.subtitle: Julia Gardiner Tyler

events.originalText: War of Jenkins' Ear: Spanish troops stormed the British-held strategically crucial position of Fort Mose in Spanish Florida.
events.subtitle: War of Jenkins' Ear

events.originalText: The Council of Pisa elected Peter of Candia as Pope Alexander V (pictured), becoming the third simultaneous claimant of the title of leader of the Roman Catholic Church.
events.subtitle: Council of Pisa

events.originalText: Mongol invasions of Anatolia: Mongols achieved a decisive victory over the Seljuq Turks, leading to the decline and disintegration of the Seljuk state.
events.subtitle: Mongol invasions of Anatolia
